intro: Semenovia glabrior, commonly known as the smooth Semenovia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate to cold climates. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and somewhat endangered species.
